title: Celebrities Honor Catherine O'Hara's Legacy in Comedy
summary: Catherine O'Hara, an Emmy-winning comedic actress from Canada, died at 71 after a brief illness at her Los Angeles home. She was renowned for her roles in iconic films such as Beetlejuice and Home Alone, as well as TV series like Schitt's Creek and The Studio. Following her death, numerous celebrities, including Meryl Streep, Pedro Pascal, and Ben Stiller, expressed heartfelt tributes. Streep praised O'Hara for bringing 'love and light' through her compassionate portrayals of eccentric characters, while Pascal expressed eternal gratitude for their collaboration. Ben Stiller highlighted her significant impact on comedy, stating there was 'no one better.' Other co-stars, such as Michael Keaton and Macaulay Culkin, shared emotional messages, with Keaton recalling their long friendship and Culkin expressing sorrow on Instagram. Director Tim Burton and actor Alec Baldwin also commemorated her unique talent and contributions to the film industry. O'Hara began her career in Canada's comedy scene and earned critical acclaim for her unforgettable performances, leaving a lasting legacy in entertainment.
